recipes.name: Bacon Garlic Fried Rice
directions: Step 1: Slice the bacon into small slivers. If using frozen bacon, partially thaw enough to slice easily.
Step 2: Fry the bacon slivers in a large wok or pan over medium-high heat until crispy. Remove the bacon and set aside to drain on a paper towel. Reserve 2-4 tablespoons of bacon fat.

Step 3: Add the minced garlic to the wok or pan with the reserved bacon fat (or vegetable oil if preferred). Cook over medium heat for about 30 seconds, or until fragrant, being careful not to brown the garlic.
Step 4: Add the cold rice and frozen peas and carrots to the pan. Increase the heat to high and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, breaking up any large clumps of rice. It's okay if some small clumps remain.
Step 5: Make a well in the center of the rice. Pour in the beaten eggs and cook until mostly set, then gradually incorporate the surrounding rice.
Step 6: Add the soy sauce and crumbled bacon to the fried rice. Mix well and season with salt to taste.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of Bacon Garlic Fried Rice, glistening with oil and showcasing crispy bacon slivers. Use a dark, textured backdrop to contrast the vibrant colors of the rice, peas, carrots, and golden-brown bacon. Shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on a cluster of bacon and rice, with the rest softly blurred. Incorporate natural, directional light to highlight the textures and steam. Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped scallions and a few whole peas and carrots scattered artfully around the plate. Aim for a warm, inviting, and appetizing mood.

video_script.title: Bacon Garlic Fried Rice - Quick & Easy Recipe
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious Bacon Garlic Fried Rice with this easy-to-follow recipe. This flavorful dish is perfect for a quick weeknight meal or a satisfying weekend lunch.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a steaming plate of finished Bacon Garlic Fried Rice, garnished with crispy bacon bits and chopped green onions. Focus on the texture and vibrant colors.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a flavorful and satisfying meal? Look no further! Today, we're making Bacon Garlic Fried Rice – it's quick, easy, and packed with savory goodness.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden cutting board.  Bacon slices, cold cooked rice, minced garlic, frozen peas and carrots, eggs, soy sauce, and salt.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: half a pound of bacon, 5 cups of cooked long-grain rice, 6 cloves of garlic, 1 1/2 cups of frozen peas and carrots, 2 eggs, oil, soy sauce, and salt.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of slicing bacon into slivers on a cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Start by slicing your bacon into small slivers. If using frozen bacon, thaw it slightly to make slicing easier.

scenes.image_prompt: Bacon frying in a wok or pan over medium-high heat until crispy.
scenes.voice_over: Fry the bacon in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat until crispy. This should take about 5-7 minutes. Remove the bacon and set it aside, reserving about 2 to 4 tablespoons of bacon fat.

scenes.image_prompt: Minced garlic being sautéed in bacon fat in a wok or pan over medium heat.
scenes.voice_over: Add the minced garlic to the wok with the reserved bacon fat. Cook for about 30 seconds over medium heat until fragrant. Be careful not to burn it.

scenes.image_prompt: Rice, peas, and carrots being stir-fried in the wok over high heat.
scenes.voice_over: Now add the cold rice and frozen peas and carrots. Crank the heat up to high and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, breaking up any large rice clumps.

scenes.image_prompt: Beaten eggs being cooked in a well in the center of the rice in the wok.
scenes.voice_over: Make a well in the center of the rice and pour in your beaten eggs. Cook until mostly set, then incorporate them into the surrounding rice.

scenes.image_prompt: Soy sauce and crispy bacon being added to the fried rice, mixing well.
scenes.voice_over: Finally, add the soy sauce and crumbled bacon. Mix everything together and season with salt to taste.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a serving of the finished Bacon Garlic Fried Rice garnished with chopped green onions and more crispy bacon bits, presented in a bowl with chopsticks.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your Bacon Garlic Fried Rice hot and enjoy! It's delicious on its own or as a side dish. Garnish with extra bacon and some green onions if desired.

cooking_tips: Day-old rice works best for fried rice, as it's drier and less likely to become mushy. If using freshly cooked rice, spread it on a baking sheet and freeze for 30-60 minutes before using.
For extra flavor, use a combination of bacon fat and vegetable oil for frying.
Don't overcrowd the pan when frying the rice. If necessary, cook the rice in batches to ensure even cooking.
Feel free to add other vegetables, such as broccoli, bell peppers, or corn, to the fried rice.

recipes.name: Kimchi Fried Rice with Crispy Tofu
ingredients: 1 cup uncooked short-grain or long-grain brown rice, rinsed
2 1/2 cups stir-fry vegetables (e.g., carrots, snap peas), bite-sized
2 tablespoons tamari or soy sauce (or gluten-free substitute)
directions: Step 1: Cook the Rice: If not using leftover rice, bring 12 cups of water to a rolling boil in a large pot. Add rinsed rice, stir, and boil uncovered for 30 minutes. Drain in a fine-mesh strainer and set aside.
Step 2: Prepare the Tofu: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Press tofu for 10 minutes to remove excess water. Cut tofu into 1/2-inch cubes.
Step 3: Bake the Tofu: Toss tofu with 1 tablespoon sesame oil and 2 tablespoons gochujang. Spread on prepared baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown and crispy.

Step 4: Sauté Vegetables: Heat 1 tablespoon sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté onion until translucent (about 2 minutes). Add garlic and stir-fry vegetables; cook for 4 minutes until vibrant and slightly softened. Stir in tamari.
Step 5: Combine Vegetables and Kimchi: Remove skillet from heat. Add kimchi and kimchi juice to the vegetables; toss to combine. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Step 6: Prepare Fried Rice: In the same skillet (off heat), combine remaining sesame oil, tamari, ginger, and cooked rice. Toss to coat. Turn heat to medium-high and spread rice in an even layer. Cook undisturbed for 2 minutes until sizzling.
Step 7: Add Gochujang: Toss rice and add remaining gochujang. Toss to coat, spread in an even layer, and cook undisturbed for 2 minutes.
Step 8: Combine Ingredients: Toss rice, then add cooked vegetables and baked tofu. Toss gently to combine.
Step 9: Serve: Garnish with sesame seeds, crumbled nori, and green onions. Serve hot.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, close-up shot of Kimchi Fried Rice with Crispy Tofu.  Focus on the glistening, golden-brown tofu and the deep red hues of the kimchi, nestled amongst fluffy brown rice and colorful vegetables. Use a shallow depth of field, emphasizing the textural details of the tofu and kimchi.  A dark, rustic wooden backdrop and matte black chopsticks will provide contrast. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and chopped scallions for a final touch of freshness. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, allowing the steam to gently rise, creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Indonesian Fried Rice with Fried Egg
directions: Step 1: Cook the jasmine rice according to package directions until tender. Drain and spread on a tray to cool.
Step 2: Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil, swirling to coat.
Step 3: Add ¾ of the sliced green onions to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute, or until softened.
Step 4: Add the frozen peas and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until bright green.
Step 5: Add the cooled rice to the wok and stir-fry for 3 minutes, or until heated through.
Step 6: Drizzle the sweet soy sauce over the rice, add half of the sliced chilies, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir-fry for 2 minutes, or until heated through.
Step 7: Remove the rice from the heat and cover to keep warm.
Step 8: Heat the remaining ½ tablespoon of peanut oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
Step 9: Crack the eggs into the pan and cook for 2 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the yolks are still soft.
Step 10: Spoon the fried rice into bowls. Top each serving with a fried egg, the remaining green onions, and the remaining sliced chilies. Serve immediately.

A perfectly fried egg, yolk runny and edges crisp, crowns the rice.  Use a dark, textured wooden background and rustic linen napkin. Shallow depth of field, focusing on the egg yolk and surrounding rice, creating a warm, inviting mood. Garnish with scattered sliced green onions and a small bowl of sambal oelek. recipes.name: Lemon Rice (Chitranna)
ingredients: 1 cup uncooked rice or 3-4 cups cooked rice
¾ teaspoon salt, or to taste
1½-2 tablespoons lemon juice, or to taste
1 teaspoon urad dal (split and skinned black lentils)
1 teaspoon chopped green chilies or 1-2 green chilies, chopped
3 tablespoons sesame oil (gingelly oil) or any neutral oil
directions: Step 1: Rinse the rice grains a couple of times and soak in enough water for 20-30 minutes. Drain the water.

Step 2: Stovetop Method: Cook rice in a 2-3 liter pressure cooker with salt and 1¾-2 cups water for 2-3 whistles or 8-10 minutes on medium-high heat. Allow the pressure to release naturally. Alternatively, simmer rice with salt and 2 cups of water in a covered pan until cooked through and fluffy. Add more hot water if needed while simmering.
Step 3: Instant Pot Method: Combine rice, salt, and 1-1¼ cups water in the insert of a 6-quart Instant Pot. Pressure cook for 5 minutes on high and then quick release.
Step 4: Spread the cooked rice in a tray or bowl to cool to room temperature.
Step 5: Heat 2 tablespoons of sesame oil in a small frying pan. Fry the peanuts until crunchy and set aside.
Step 6: In the same oil, fry the cashews until golden and set aside.
Step 7: Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of sesame oil to the pan. Over low heat, add mustard seeds and let them crackle. Add urad dal and fry until golden brown.
Step 8: Add dried red chilies, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté for a few seconds until the chilies change color.
Step 9: Turn off the heat and add asafoetida and turmeric powder. Mix well.
Step 10: Pour the tempering over the cooled rice. Add fried peanuts, cashews, lemon juice, and salt. Mix thoroughly.
Step 11: Cover and let the flavors blend for 4-5 minutes before serving.
Step 12: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves (cilantro) if desired. Serve with pappadums, a vegetable salad, or coconut chutney.

recipes.name: Korean Beef and Anchovy Rice Balls (Jumeokbap)
ingredients: 3 cups cooked short-grain or medium-grain rice (approximately 520g)
80g dried anchovies, extra small, finely chopped
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Beef Rice Ball Filling: In a small bowl, combine 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon mirin, 1 1/2 tablespoons dark brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon sesame oil. Mix well and set aside.
Step 2: Cook the Beef and Carrots: Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef and cook until browned halfway.

Step 3: Add Carrots and Sauce: Add the diced carrots to the pan and stir. Once the beef is fully cooked, pour in the prepared sauce and add the cooked rice. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the rice is well coated with the sauce.
Step 4: Cool the Mixture: Transfer the beef and rice mixture to a medium-sized bowl and let it cool until safe to handle.
Step 5: Shape the Rice Balls: Take a handful of the mixture and squeeze it firmly between your hands to form a ball. Repeat until all the mixture is used. This should yield about 7-8 rice balls.

Step 6: Prepare the Anchovy Rice Ball Filling (Optional): In a small bowl, combine 1 1/3 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 1/3 tablespoons mirin, 1 tablespoon dark brown sugar, 1/2 tablespoon honey, and 1/2 tablespoon sesame oil. Mix well and set aside.
Step 7: Cook the Anchovies: Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add the chopped anchovies and stir-fry for about 1 minute to reduce the fishy smell.
Step 8: Add Sauce to Anchovies: Pour the prepared anchovy sauce over the anchovies and mix well. Cook for about 1 minute, or until the anchovies are well coated.
Step 9: Combine Anchovies and Rice: In a medium-sized bowl, combine the cooked rice and the stir-fried anchovies. Mix thoroughly.
Step 10: Shape the Anchovy Rice Balls: Take a handful of the anchovy and rice mixture and squeeze it firmly between your hands to form a ball. Repeat until all the mixture is used.
Step 11: Optional Coating: Roll the rice balls in seasoned seaweed flakes, if desired. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Hibachi Chicken with Fried Rice and Vegetables
ingredients: 1-1.5 lbs Chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 large White onion, cut into slivers
directions: 1. Prepare the rice ahead of time and allow it to cool completely.
2. Cook the chicken and vegetables simultaneously in separate skillets or woks.
3. For the Hibachi Chicken: Heat vegetable oil and sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
4. Add chicken, soy sauce, butter, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to the skillet.
5. Sauté for 6-8 minutes, or until cooked through and no longer pink.
6. Set aside and keep warm.
7. For the Hibachi Vegetables: Heat vegetable oil and sesame oil in a separate skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
8. Add white onion, zucchini, butter, soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
9. Sauté for 6-8 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
10. Set aside and keep warm.
11. For the Hibachi Fried Rice: In the same skillet used for the chicken, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
12. Add chopped white onion and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until softened.
13. Add bean sprouts and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
14. Push the vegetables to one side of the pan.
15. Add the eggs and lightly scramble them.
16. Once scrambled, add the cooled rice and butter.
17. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
18. Add soy sauce and cook for an additional minute.
19. For the Hibachi Bean Sprouts: In the same skillet used for the vegetables, melt the butter.
20. Add soy sauce and bean sprouts.
21. Sauté for 1-2 minutes.
22. Serve the hibachi chicken, vegetables, fried rice, and bean sprouts together.

directions: Step 1: Heat the sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.

Step 3: Add the diced pineapple, diced red bell pepper, and diced yellow bell pepper to the wok. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until slightly softened.

recipes.name: Rice Cooker Fried Rice
directions: Step 1: In a medium-sized skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Step 2: Add the chopped onion and diced carrots to the skillet and sauté until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Add the rice to the skillet and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned.
Step 4: Transfer the rice mixture, chicken broth, water chestnuts, mushrooms, bean sprouts, and soy sauce to the rice cooker.
Step 5: If using, add the red chili paste to the rice cooker.
Step 6: Start the rice cooker according to the manufacturer's instructions for white rice.
Step 7: While the rice is cooking, whisk the egg in a small bowl.
Step 8: Wipe out the skillet and cook the whisked egg over medium-low heat until set, then chop the cooked egg.
Step 9: Once the rice cooker finishes, gently stir in the chopped egg. Let the fried rice sit in the rice cooker for 5-10 minutes to steam before serving.
Step 10: Serve hot and enjoy!

scenes.voice_over: Add the rice to the skillet and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned. This toasting adds a nice nutty flavor.

scenes.voice_over: Transfer everything to your rice cooker: the rice mixture, chicken broth, one cup of sliced water chestnuts, one cup of mixed mushrooms, one cup of bean sprouts, and the soy sauce. Add the chili paste now if you're using it.

scenes.voice_over: Once the rice cooker finishes, gently stir in the chopped egg.  Let the fried rice sit in the cooker for 5 to 10 minutes to steam.

recipes.name: Thai Shrimp Fried Rice
ingredients: 2 cups medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 fresh red chili pepper, minced (or 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes)
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, 2 tablespoons fish sauce, soy sauce, and brown sugar until the sugar dissolves. Set aside.
Step 2: Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil.
Step 3: Add the minced garlic and chili pepper (or red pepper flakes) to the wok and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Step 4: Add the shrimp to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until pink and cooked through.
Step 5: Add the grated carrot (or frozen peas) and cilantro to the wok. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes.
Step 6: Add the cooked rice to the wok and pour the prepared sauce over the rice. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, using a scooping motion to distribute the sauce evenly.
Step 7: Push the rice to one side of the wok. Add the remaining 1-2 tablespoons of oil to the cleared space.
Step 8: Crack the egg into the cleared space and scramble quickly. Gradually incorporate the scrambled egg into the rice.
Step 9: Remove the wok from the heat. Sprinkle with white pepper and sliced green onions.
Step 10: Taste and adjust seasoning. Add more fish sauce (1/2 to 1 tablespoon) if desired, or lime juice if it's too salty.

recipes.name: Chicken Fried Rice
ingredients: 600g chicken breast fillets, trimmed and thinly sliced
1 brown onion, cut into thin wedges
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine the light soy sauce, sweet chili sauce, and oyster sauce. Set aside.
Step 2: Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat until hot. Add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil and swirl to coat.
Step 3: Add half of the chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until browned. Transfer to a plate.
Step 4: Repeat with another tablespoon of peanut oil and the remaining chicken. Transfer to the plate.
Step 5: Add the remaining 2 teaspoons of peanut oil and the onion to the wok. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until softened and golden.
Step 6: Add the crushed garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds, or until fragrant.
Step 7: Add the beaten eggs and stir-fry for 1 minute, or until lightly scrambled.
Step 8: Add the cold cooked rice to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until heated through and combined with the egg.
Step 9: Return the cooked chicken to the wok.
Step 10: Pour the soy sauce mixture over the rice and chicken. Add the Thai basil leaves and sliced green onions.
Step 11: Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until everything is well combined and heated through.
Step 12: Serve immediately, garnished with fried shallots.

recipes.name: Homemade Garaetteok (Korean Rice Cakes)
ingredients: 2 ½ cups short-grain or medium-grain rice (such as sushi rice), for rice flour
Water, for soaking and rinsing rice
2 cups wet-milled rice flour (300g), from short or medium grain rice
¾ cup boiling water, divided (for microwave method)
⅔ cup boiling water (for steamer method)
directions: Step 1: Making Rice Flour: Rinse 2 ½ cups of rice until water runs clear. Soak in a bowl of water overnight or for 12 hours.
Step 2: Drain the rice and air dry for 1 hour.
Step 3: Grind the rice in a food processor until it becomes a fine powder, scraping down the sides as needed.
Step 4: Sift the rice flour twice to remove any clumps or unground grains. Re-grind any large pieces.
Step 5: Microwave Method: Combine rice flour, cornstarch, salt, and ¼ cup boiling water in a microwave-safe bowl. Mix well. Add another ¼ cup of boiling water and mix.
Step 6: Cover the bowl with cling wrap, leaving a small vent. Microwave for 2 minutes.
Step 7: Add the remaining ¼ cup boiling water, cover, and microwave for 1 ½ minutes.
Step 8: Steamer Method: Combine rice flour, cornstarch, salt, and ⅔ cup boiling water in a bowl. Mix well.
Step 9: Place the rice flour mixture in a steamer lined with baking paper or a clean tea towel. Steam for 20 minutes over high heat.
Step 10: Shaping the Rice Cakes (Both Methods): Cover a cutting board with a silicone mat or cling wrap. Place the hot rice cake dough on the mat.
Step 11: Wearing heat-resistant gloves, knead and pound the dough with a pestle for about 5 minutes.
Step 12: For Tteokbokki: Divide the dough into 5 pieces. Coat with sesame oil. Roll each piece into a 1-1.5 cm diameter cylinder. Cut into 6 cm lengths.
Step 13: For Tteokguk: Divide the dough into 2 pieces. Coat with sesame oil. Roll each piece into a 2-3 cm diameter cylinder.
Step 14: Refrigerate the Tteokguk rice cakes for 1 hour before slicing thinly (0.5cm) and diagonally.

Use a shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on the foreground pieces, showcasing their soft, chewy texture. Incorporate subtle backlighting to highlight the translucence and subtle sheen from the sesame oil.  Garnish with a sprinkle of toasted sesame seeds and a small sprig of fresh parsley for a pop of vibrant green. Aim for a warm, inviting mood with a slightly overhead, angled shot.

video_script.title: Homemade Garaetteok (Korean Rice Cakes)
video_script.description: Learn how to make chewy and delicious Garaetteok (Korean Rice Cakes) from scratch, perfect for Tteokbokki and Tteokguk!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a bowl of vibrant red Tteokbokki (spicy rice cakes) and a bowl of comforting Tteokguk (rice cake soup). Steam rises from the dishes, highlighting the chewy texture of the garaetteok.
scenes.voice_over: Today, we're making garaetteok, Korean rice cakes, from scratch!  These versatile rice cakes are the base for iconic dishes like spicy Tteokbokki and soothing Tteokguk.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredients neatly arranged on a table. Separate the rice and water from the dry and wet ingredients required for the dough.
scenes.voice_over: For the rice flour, you'll need short-grain rice and water. For the dough, gather wet-milled rice flour, cornstarch, salt, boiling water, and sesame oil.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the process of rinsing rice, soaking it overnight, and then grinding it to a fine powder in a food processor.
scenes.voice_over: Rinse the rice until the water runs clear, then soak overnight. Drain and air dry for an hour. Grind into a fine powder in a food processor, sifting twice for a smooth dough.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the mixing process in a microwave-safe bowl with the ingredients clearly labeled. Show covering the bowl with cling wrap.
scenes.voice_over: Combine dry ingredients with 1/4 cup boiling water, mix. Add another 1/4 cup, mix. Cover with cling wrap, vent. Microwave for 2 minutes. Add remaining water, microwave 1.5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the mixing process for the steamer method. Show a steamer basket lined with baking paper, and the rice flour mixture inside, ready to be steamed.
scenes.voice_over: Alternatively, mix dry ingredients with 2/3 cup boiling water. Steam the mixture in a lined steamer for 20 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the hot dough on a silicone mat, being kneaded and pounded with a pestle. Show a close-up of the dough’s texture before and after kneading.

scenes.voice_over: For Tteokbokki, divide into 5 pieces, roll into 1-1.5cm cylinders, cut into 6cm lengths. Coat with sesame oil.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the process of shaping the dough for Tteokguk: dividing, rolling into thicker cylinders, refrigerating, then slicing thinly at an angle.
scenes.voice_over: For Tteokguk, divide into 2 pieces, roll into 2-3cm cylinders. Refrigerate for 1 hour, then slice thinly at an angle. Coat with sesame oil.

cooking_tips: For extra chewy rice cakes, use glutinous rice flour (chapssal flour).
If you don't have a pestle, you can knead the dough vigorously by hand.

recipes.name: Perfect Sushi Rice
directions: Step 1: Rinse the Rice: Place the sushi rice in a large bowl. Add enough cold water to half-fill the bowl and gently swirl the rice. Drain the cloudy water. Repeat this rinsing and swirling process 3-4 times until the water runs clear. Gently scrunch the rice with your hands while rinsing. Transfer the rinsed rice to a large saucepan and add the 3 1/3 cups of water. Let the rice soak for at least 30 minutes.

Step 2: Prepare the Sushi Vinegar: In a small saucepan, combine the rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and dashi powder. Heat over low heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar and salt are completely dissolved. Do not boil. Remove from heat and let cool.

Step 3: Cook the Rice: Secure the lid tightly on the saucepan containing the soaked rice. Turn the heat to high. Once boiling, reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, remove from heat and let stand, covered, for another 15 minutes.

Step 4: Combine Rice and Vinegar: Gently transfer the cooked rice to a large non-metallic bowl (wood or glass preferred). Gradually pour the cooled sushi vinegar over the rice. Using a rice paddle or spatula, gently fold the vinegar into the rice using a slicing motion. While folding, use your other hand to fan the rice to cool it to room temperature.

Step 5: Serve: Serve the sushi rice immediately for best results. The rice should be shiny, sticky, and each grain distinct. If not using immediately, cover the bowl with a damp cloth to prevent the rice from drying out.

video_script.title: Perfect Sushi Rice: A Step-by-Step Guide
video_script.description: Learn how to make perfect sushi rice at home with this easy-to-follow recipe.  We'll cover rinsing, cooking, and seasoning for delicious, sticky rice every time.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a perfectly formed sushi roll, glistening with a subtle sheen, highlighting the individual grains of rice.  A pair of chopsticks are delicately lifting a piece, revealing its sticky consistency.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're mastering the art of perfect sushi rice – the foundation of any great sushi dish.  Get ready for fluffy, sticky, perfectly seasoned rice!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredients arranged on a clean surface: 3 cups of sushi rice in a bowl, a measuring cup with 3 1/3 cups of water, rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and dashi powder in separate small bowls.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: 3 cups of sushi rice, 3 1/3 cups of water, half a cup of rice vinegar, a quarter cup of sugar, half a teaspoon of salt, and a tablespoon of dashi powder for that authentic flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands gently swirling rice in a bowl of water, then the cloudy water being drained. This is repeated several times until the water runs clear.
scenes.voice_over: First, rinse the sushi rice in a large bowl until the water runs clear.  This removes excess starch for perfectly separated grains. Repeat the process 3-4 times, gently scrunching the rice with your hands.

scenes.image_prompt: Rice in a pot with water, soaking. Timer next to it showing 30 minutes.
scenes.voice_over: Now, transfer the rinsed rice to a saucepan, add the 3 1/3 cups of water, and let it soak for at least 30 minutes. This helps achieve uniform cooking.

scenes.image_prompt: Small saucepan on a stovetop. Inside, rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and dashi powder are being mixed. Steam gently rises from the pan.
scenes.voice_over: While the rice soaks, combine the rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and dashi powder in a small saucepan. Heat over low, stirring constantly, until everything is dissolved.  Don't let it boil!

scenes.image_prompt: Covered pot of rice simmering on the stovetop. A timer is set for 15 minutes.
scenes.voice_over: Cover the rice pot tightly, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, remove from heat and let it rest, covered, for another 15 minutes. This allows the rice to steam to perfection.

scenes.image_prompt: A wooden bowl filled with cooked rice. The sushi vinegar is being gently folded in with a rice paddle. Another hand fans the rice to cool it down.
scenes.voice_over: Gently transfer the cooked rice to a large non-metallic bowl. Gradually pour the cooled sushi vinegar over the rice and gently fold it in using a slicing motion. Fan the rice while mixing to cool it to room temperature.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished sushi rice in a bowl. The rice is shiny, sticky, and the individual grains are distinct.  In the background, various sushi ingredients are displayed: nori sheets, sliced avocado, cucumber, and raw fish.
scenes.voice_over: Your perfect sushi rice is ready!  Serve it immediately for the best flavor and texture.  Or, if you're prepping ahead, cover with a damp cloth to prevent drying. Now you're ready to create amazing sushi! Enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: Close up of a variety of sushi made with the prepared rice. Examples include nigiri, maki rolls, and inside-out rolls.  The sushi is beautifully arranged on a serving platter, garnished with pickled ginger and wasabi.
scenes.voice_over: From simple nigiri to elaborate rolls, the possibilities are endless! Your perfect sushi rice is ready for any adventure. Nutrition information per serving: approximately 200 calories, 4 grams of protein, 44 grams of carbs, and 0.5 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: Use a rice cooker for easier cooking if available.
Fanning the rice while mixing in the vinegar helps achieve the desired shiny texture.
A damp cloth helps to keep the rice from drying out while storing.

recipes.name: Restaurant-Style Chinese Fried Rice
directions: Step 1: Cook the rice according to package directions, using 2 cups of water, until slightly firm. Spread the cooked rice on a baking sheet to cool completely. You can expedite cooling by placing the baking sheet in the freezer.
Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the eggs and scramble until cooked through. Remove the scrambled eggs from the wok and set aside.
Step 3: Add the cubed ham and frozen peas to the wok and stir-fry for about 1 minute. Remove the ham and peas from the wok.
Step 4: Wipe the wok clean. Add the remaining oil and heat over high heat until shimmering.

Step 5: Add the cooled rice to the wok and stir to coat each grain with oil. Gradually add the chicken stock, allowing the rice to absorb the liquid. Continue stirring until all the liquid is absorbed and the rice is heated through.
Step 6: Add the scrambled eggs, ham, peas, soy sauce, and salt to the rice. Stir to combine.
Step 7: Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve hot.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a dynamic close-up of restaurant-style Chinese fried rice, featuring fluffy basmati grains, glistening with canola oil and soy sauce.  Cubed ham and vibrant green peas should be clearly visible. Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on a cluster of rice grains and ham, blurring the background slightly. Soft, diffused lighting should highlight the texture and golden hues of the rice. Compose the dish in a dark-grey textured bowl with simple chopsticks, against a dark wooden backdrop. Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped scallions for a pop of fresh green. Aim for a warm, inviting mood, evoking the comfort of a delicious, home-cooked meal.

video_script.title: Restaurant-Style Chinese Fried Rice
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious restaurant-style Chinese fried rice at home with this easy-to-follow recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a steaming plate of golden-brown Chinese fried rice, garnished with chopped green onions. The rice is fluffy and each grain is distinct. Pieces of ham, peas, and scrambled eggs are visible.
scenes.voice_over: Craving takeout? Learn to make restaurant-quality Chinese fried rice at home! This recipe is quick, easy, and yields perfectly fluffy rice every time.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredients arranged neatly on a countertop. Grouped together are: uncooked basmati rice in a measuring cup, chicken stock, and water in separate containers. Next to them is a ham steak on a cutting board, a bowl of frozen peas, eggs in a small bowl, a bottle of canola oil, salt, and soy sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: basmati rice, chicken stock, ham steak, frozen peas, eggs, canola or peanut oil, salt, and soy sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of basmati rice being spread onto a baking sheet to cool. The rice is slightly firm, not mushy.
scenes.voice_over: Cook the basmati rice according to package directions, but aim for a slightly firm texture.  Spread the cooked rice on a baking sheet to cool completely.  This helps prevent the rice from becoming sticky in the stir-fry.  You can speed up the cooling process by placing the baking sheet in the freezer for about 15 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of a wok over high heat with scrambled eggs being cooked. The eggs are light and fluffy.
scenes.voice_over: Heat a tablespoon of oil in your wok or large skillet over high heat. Add two eggs and scramble until just cooked through. Remove the eggs and set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of the wok with ham and peas being stir-fried. The ham is lightly browned.
scenes.voice_over: Add the cubed ham and frozen peas to the wok.  Stir-fry for about a minute until the ham is lightly browned and the peas are heated through. Remove from the wok and set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of the rice being added to the hot wok with oil, and being stirred constantly.
scenes.voice_over: Wipe the wok clean, add the remaining oil, and heat over high heat. Add the cooled rice and stir continuously to coat each grain with oil.  This toasting step is key to getting that restaurant-style flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the rice in the wok as chicken stock is gradually added and stirred in.
scenes.voice_over: Gradually add the chicken stock, about half to three-quarters of a cup, allowing the rice to absorb the liquid. Keep stirring until the rice is heated through and the liquid has been absorbed.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of the combined ingredients being stir-fried together in the wok.
scenes.voice_over: Return the scrambled eggs, ham, and peas to the wok.  Add two tablespoons of soy sauce and a quarter teaspoon of salt. Stir everything together until well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished fried rice plated and garnished with chopped green onions. A pair of chopsticks are placed next to the plate.
scenes.voice_over: Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve your delicious restaurant-style fried rice hot.  This dish is perfect on its own or as a side with your favorite Chinese entrees.

scenes.image_prompt: Text-based graphic displaying the nutritional information per serving: Calories: 350, Protein: 15g, Carbs: 50g, Fat: 12g.
scenes.voice_over: Per serving, this fried rice has approximately 350 calories, 15 grams of protein, 50 grams of carbs, and 12 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: For best results, use day-old rice. Freshly cooked rice can be too moist and result in sticky fried rice.
If you don't have a wok, a large skillet or frying pan can be used.
Feel free to add other vegetables, such as chopped carrots, onions, or bell peppers, to the stir-fry.
For a vegetarian version, omit the ham and use vegetable stock instead of chicken stock.

recipes.name: Classic Fried Rice
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Rice: Cook 2 cups of rice according to package directions. Drain well and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to cool completely.
Step 2: Scramble the Eggs: Heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add the beaten eggs and cook until golden brown. Remove from the pan, slice, and set aside.
Step 3: Sauté the Aromatics: Add the remaining peanut oil to the skillet and increase the heat to high. Add the chopped onion and sauté until it begins to turn translucent.
Step 4: Cook the Bacon: Add the diced bacon to the skillet and cook until heated through and slightly crispy.
Step 5: Combine and Fry: Add the chilled rice, peas, and corn to the skillet. Stir-fry for 3 minutes, until heated through.

Step 6: Add Remaining Ingredients: Add the cooked prawns (if using), sliced shallots (if using), sliced eggs, and soy sauce to the skillet. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes, until everything is well combined and heated through.
Step 7: Serve: Serve the fried rice immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant close-up of classic fried rice, glistening with peanut oil, featuring fluffy chilled rice, crispy bacon, succulent prawns, and colorful corn and peas.  Employ a shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on a single prawn, with softly blurred rice grains in the foreground and background.  Utilize dark slate or wooden chopsticks elegantly placed amidst the rice.  Side lighting should highlight the texture and steam, creating a warm, inviting mood against a dark, rustic backdrop.  Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped shallots for a pop of green.

recipes.name: Classic Chicken Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups boneless, skinless chicken (light, dark, or mixed)
1/2 cup peanut oil or olive oil
directions: Step 1: Marinate the chicken (optional): In a bowl, combine the chicken with garlic powder, salt, white pepper, sherry, and cornstarch. Mix well and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight.
Step 2: Prepare ingredients: Chop the onion, mince the garlic and ginger, and beat the eggs.

Step 3: Stir-fry the chicken: Heat 1-2 tablespoons of oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the marinated chicken and stir-fry until cooked through and slightly browned. Remove from the wok and set aside.
Step 4: Scramble the eggs: Add a little more oil to the wok, if needed. Scramble the eggs until cooked through. Remove from the wok and set aside.
Step 5: Sauté vegetables (if using fresh): Add another tablespoon of oil to the wok. Sauté the chopped onion until softened, then add the minced garlic and ginger. Stir-fry for 1 minute.
Step 6: Stir-fry frozen vegetables: Add the frozen peas and carrots to the wok. Cover and steam for 2-3 minutes, or until heated through. Remove from the wok and set aside.
Step 7: Fry the rice: Add the remaining oil to the wok. Add the cold rice and stir-fry until heated through and slightly crispy. Add the soy sauce and stir-fry for another minute.

Step 8: Combine and serve: Add the cooked chicken, scrambled eggs, and vegetables to the rice. Toss everything together. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped green onions (optional). Serve hot.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of classic chicken fried rice, glistening with peanut oil, in a rustic, dark-grey bowl.  Chopsticks rest casually on the edge. Soft, diffused natural light from the side highlights the texture of the chicken and rice, with a shallow depth of field focusing on a piece of chicken.  Garnish with chopped scallions and a sprinkle of sesame seeds. The background should be dark and slightly blurred, creating a warm, inviting mood. Aim for a rich, savory, and comforting visual story.

video_script.title: Classic Chicken Fried Rice
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious chicken fried rice at home with this easy-to-follow recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients laid out on a table: chicken breast, garlic powder, salt, pepper, sherry, and cornstarch in a bowl. Separate pile of cooked rice, oil, eggs, chopped onion, minced garlic, frozen peas and carrots, and optional ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, and green onions.

We'll also use cooked, cold rice, oil, eggs, onion, garlic, frozen peas and carrots, and optionally, fresh ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, and green onions for garnish.

scenes.voice_over: First, marinate the chicken. Combine the chicken with garlic powder, salt, white pepper, sherry, and cornstarch. Mix well and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight. This step is optional but highly recommended for maximum flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Chopped onion, minced garlic, minced ginger, and beaten eggs in separate bowls.
scenes.voice_over: While the chicken marinates, prep the other ingredients. Chop the onion, mince the garlic and ginger, and beat the eggs.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken stir-frying in a wok over high heat.
scenes.voice_over: Heat 1-2 tablespoons of oil in a wok over high heat. Add the marinated chicken and stir-fry until cooked through and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken and set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Eggs scrambling in the wok.
scenes.voice_over: Add a touch more oil to the wok if needed. Scramble the eggs until cooked through, about 1 minute. Remove and set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Onions, garlic, and ginger being sautéed in the wok.
scenes.voice_over: Add another tablespoon of oil to the wok. Sauté the chopped onion until softened, then add the minced garlic and ginger. Stir-fry for about 1 minute until fragrant.

scenes.image_prompt: Frozen peas and carrots being stir-fried in the wok.
scenes.voice_over: Add the frozen peas and carrots to the wok. Cover and steam for 2-3 minutes, or until heated through. Remove from the wok and set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Rice being stir-fried in the wok until heated through and slightly crispy.
scenes.voice_over: Add the remaining oil to the wok.  Add the cold rice and stir-fry for about 3-5 minutes until heated through and slightly crispy. Add the soy sauce and stir-fry for another minute.

scenes.image_prompt: All ingredients being combined in the wok and tossed together.
scenes.voice_over: Add the cooked chicken, scrambled eggs, and vegetables to the rice. Toss everything together. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle with sesame oil (if using) and garnish with chopped green onions.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished dish, garnished with green onions, served with chopsticks and a side of chili sauce (optional).
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious chicken fried rice hot!  It's great as a standalone dish or served with your favorite sides.

cooking_tips: For best results, use cold, day-old rice. This helps it fry more evenly and prevents it from becoming sticky.
If using olive oil, be sure to use a high-heat variety to prevent smoking.
Feel free to add other vegetables, such as chopped bell peppers or mushrooms.
For a spicier dish, add a pinch of red pepper flakes or a dash of sriracha sauce.

recipes.name: Pineapple Fried Rice with Chicken and Raisins
directions: Step 1: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 2: Add the minced garlic and stir-fry until fragrant (about 30 seconds).
Step 3: Pour in the whisked eggs and cook, stirring occasionally, until scrambled and set.
Step 4: Add the cooked rice, diced chicken, and chopped scallions to the wok.
Step 5: Season with soy sauce, salt, white pepper powder, and sugar. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until heated through and well combined.
Step 6: Add the chopped pineapple and raisins. Stir-fry for another minute to incorporate.
Step 7: Garnish with fried cashews and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Egg and Scallion Fried Rice
directions: Step 1: Cook 2 cups of white rice according to package directions (or use a rice cooker with 2 cups rice and 3 cups water). Once cooked, spread the rice on a large baking sheet to cool completely.
Step 2: Prepare all ingredients: chop the onion and scallions, and beat the eggs. In a small bowl, whisk together the beaten eggs, 1 tablespoon of soy sauce, and black pepper.
Step 3: Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat until very hot.

Step 4: Add 1 tablespoon of oil to the hot wok and swirl to coat the sides. Add the egg mixture and swirl to coat. Cook quickly, scraping the egg as it cooks, until set but not browned (2-3 minutes). Transfer the cooked egg to a bowl and set aside.
Step 5: Add 2 tablespoons of oil to the hot wok. Add the chopped onions and cook until softened and slightly browned (3-5 minutes).
Step 6: Add the cooled rice to the wok. Every few minutes, scrape the bottom and sides of the wok to ensure even cooking and create some crispy rice.
Step 7: Once the rice starts to crisp, drizzle 1-2 tablespoons of soy sauce along the edges of the rice and stir-fry to incorporate. Continue to scrape the bottom of the wok to encourage crisping.
Step 8: Drizzle 1 tablespoon of oil along the edges of the rice to further crisp it up.
Step 9: Sprinkle sesame seeds over the rice to your liking and stir in.
Step 10: Drizzle 1 tablespoon (or more) of toasted sesame oil along the edges of the rice and stir in.
Step 11: Chop the cooked egg and add it to the rice. Stir to combine.
Step 12: Add the chopped scallions and stir.
Step 13: Season with salt to taste, stirring well and adding more salt as needed.
Step 14: Add more soy sauce or toasted sesame oil to taste, if desired.

Use soft, diffused natural light to create a bright and inviting mood. A shallow depth of field focuses sharply on the foreground rice, with the background gently blurred. Style the rice in a rustic, textured bowl with a dark, matte backdrop. Garnish with sesame seeds and a few perfect scallion rings. Compose with negative space for a clean, modern feel.

recipes.name: Kimchi Fried Rice with Fried Egg
ingredients: 3 cups cooked and chilled rice (day-old preferred)
3/4 cup kimchi, drained, chopped, and squeezed dry
3/4 cup optional vegetables (such as diced carrots, peas, or corn) or 3/4 cup firm tofu, cut into small pieces
Optional: Chili paste or sriracha to taste
directions: Step 1: Heat vegetable oil in a large cast-iron skillet or wok over high heat.
Step 2: Add garlic and the 1-inch green onion pieces; stir-fry for 20 seconds.
Step 3: If using optional vegetables or tofu, add them to the skillet and stir-fry until cooked through (vegetables) or lightly browned (tofu).

Step 4: Add the cooked rice and toss to coat with the oil. Continue to fry, tossing occasionally, allowing the rice to brown and crisp in places. Break up large clumps, but leave some smaller clumps intact.
Step 5: Add kimchi, sesame oil, salt, and optional chili paste or sriracha. Stir-fry for 1 minute. If using pre-cooked vegetables, add them now.
Step 6: While the rice is frying, fry an egg per serving to desired doneness (sunny-side up with a runny yolk is recommended).
Step 7: Serve the kimchi fried rice immediately, topped with the remaining sliced green onion and fried egg.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Salmon with Wasabi Fried Rice
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the teriyaki sauce, lime zest, and 1 teaspoon of wasabi powder. Add the salmon fillets, turning to coat them evenly. Marinate for 10 minutes.
Step 2: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Cook the salmon for 2 minutes per side, until crisp, sticky, and cooked through.
Step 3: Remove the salmon from the pan and flake into large chunks. Set aside.
Step 4: Pour the leftover marinade into the pan. Add the stir-fry vegetables and cook for 3-5 minutes, until slightly softened.
Step 5: In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining 2 teaspoons of wasabi powder, lime juice, and soy sauce. Add this mixture to the pan along with the cooked rice. Stir to combine.
Step 6: Once the rice is heated through, gently fold in the flaked salmon and chopped coriander. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Fried Cauliflower Rice with Sriracha Fried Eggs
directions: Step 1: Pulse the cauliflower florets in a food processor until they resemble rice grains.
Step 2: Heat the sesame oil in a large frying pan or wok over medium heat. Add the cauliflower rice and a pinch of salt. Fry for 10 minutes, stirring regularly, until lightly browned.
Step 3: Add the stir-fry baby vegetables to the pan and fry for 3-4 minutes.
Step 4: In a small bowl, whisk together the gochujang, tamari soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, crushed garlic, and grated ginger.
Step 5: Add the sauce and frozen peas to the cauliflower rice. Fry for 2 minutes, then remove from heat and keep warm.
Step 6: Heat the vegetable oil in a separate frying pan. Fry the eggs to your liking.
Step 7: Serve the cauliflower rice topped with the fried eggs, chopped coriander, and spring onions. Garnish with lime wedges and sriracha.

recipes.name: Prawn Fried Rice
ingredients: 6 rashers bacon, rind removed, coarsely chopped (approximately 1.5cm pieces)
8 green shallots, ends trimmed, thinly sliced diagonally
directions: Step 1: Cook the rice according to package directions until tender.
Step 2: Spread the cooked rice on a baking tray and refrigerate overnight to cool completely.
Step 3: Heat the peanut oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat until just smoking.
Step 4: Add the prawns and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, or until they curl and turn pink.
Step 5: Remove the prawns from the wok and set aside.
Step 6: Add the bacon to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until golden and crisp.
Step 7: Remove the bacon from the wok and set aside.
Step 8: Pour the whisked eggs into the wok and swirl gently. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until almost set.
Step 9: Use a wooden spoon to stir and break up the cooked egg.
Step 10: Return the prawns, bacon, and rice to the wok. Add the soy sauce and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until the rice is heated through.
Step 11: Add the shallots and bean sprouts to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute, or until combined.
Step 12: Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Vietnamese Fried Rice
ingredients: 150g Snow peas, trimmed and cut into thirds diagonally
115g Fresh baby corn, cut into thirds diagonally
4 Shallots, ends trimmed and thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: Rinse the rice: Place the rice in a sieve and rinse under cold running water until the water runs clear.

Step 2: Cook the rice: Place the rinsed rice and 500ml of water in a medium saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil, stirring often. Reduce heat to low, cover with a tight-fitting lid, and cook for 12 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender. Remove from heat and set aside, covered, for 5 minutes. Use a fork to separate the grains.
Step 3: Cool the rice: Spread the cooked rice over a baking tray and set aside to cool completely. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Step 4: Prepare the sauce: Combine the soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil in a small bowl. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Set aside.

Step 5: Stir-fry vegetables: Heat peanut oil in a non-stick wok or large skillet over high heat. Stir-fry the garlic for 1 minute, or until aromatic. Add snow peas, baby corn, and carrot; toss to combine. Add the extra water and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender-crisp and the liquid has evaporated.

Step 6: Add rice and egg: Add the chilled rice to the wok and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 4 minutes, or until heated through. Make a well in the center and add the whisked eggs. Cook, stirring the egg, for 30 seconds, or until the egg starts to cook. Stir-fry for 1 minute, or until the egg and rice mixture are combined.
Step 7: Finish the dish: Add the soy sauce mixture and toss to combine. Season with white pepper. Stir in the shallot. Divide among serving bowls.

recipes.name: Gobi Manchurian in Gravy
ingredients: 1 medium head cauliflower, cut into florets
½ to ¾ teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder
½ cup chopped white parts of scallions, reserve green parts for garnish
½ cup finely chopped green bell pepper
1 ½-inch piece ginger, finely chopped (or 3 teaspoons finely chopped ginger)
8 to 10 medium garlic cloves, finely chopped (or 3 teaspoons finely chopped garlic)
2 green chilies, finely chopped (or 1 teaspoon finely chopped green chilies)
½ to ¾ teaspoon ground black pepper
directions: Step 1: Blanch the cauliflower: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the cauliflower florets and blanch for 10-15 minutes until slightly tender. Drain and set aside.

Step 2: Prepare the batter: In a bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, cornstarch, soy sauce, black pepper, Kashmiri red chili powder, and salt. Gradually add water while whisking until a smooth batter forms, ensuring no lumps.

Step 3: Fry the cauliflower: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat. Dip each cauliflower floret in the batter, ensuring it's fully coated. Fry in batches until golden brown and crispy, about 5-7 minutes per batch. Remove and drain on paper towels.

Step 4: Prepare the sauce: In the same pan, add a little more oil if needed. Add chopped ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Sauté for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the white parts of scallions, bell pepper, and celery (if using). Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.

Step 5: Combine and simmer: Add light soy sauce, tomato ketchup, black pepper, and salt. Stir well. Add the fried cauliflower florets and toss to coat evenly. Add rice vinegar and mix. Check the taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Step 6: Finish and serve: Garnish with the reserved green parts of scallions. Serve Gobi Manchurian hot as a snack or with rice or noodles.

recipes.name: Classic Egg Fried Rice
ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, or as needed
directions: Step 1: Finely chop the scallions, separating the white and green parts. Set aside.
Step 2: In a bowl, whisk the eggs together until light and frothy.
Step 3: Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of oil and sauté the white parts of the scallions until softened and fragrant.
Step 4: Reduce heat to medium-low, add the whisked eggs, and gently scramble until they are just set but still slightly moist. Remove the eggs from the skillet and set aside.
Step 5: Increase the heat back to medium-high. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil to the skillet. Add the green parts of the scallions and stir-fry until fragrant.
Step 6: Pour in the soy sauce and stir to combine.
Step 7: Add the cooked rice to the skillet and stir-fry, breaking up any clumps, until the rice is heated through and lightly toasted.
Step 8: Return the scrambled eggs to the skillet. Gently mix with the rice, breaking up the eggs into smaller pieces.
Step 9: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle with sesame oil and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of classic egg fried rice, glistening with sesame oil, in a rustic, textured ceramic bowl.  The focus should be sharp on individual grains of rice and golden-brown scrambled eggs, with a shallow depth of field blurring the scallion greens. Soft, directional natural light from the side highlights the textures.  Garnish with a sprinkle of sesame seeds and chopped scallions. A dark wooden backdrop and simple chopsticks add context. The mood should be warm, inviting, and appetizing.

video_script.title: Classic Egg Fried Rice
video_script.description: Learn how to make perfect egg fried rice at home with this easy-to-follow recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a steaming plate of golden egg fried rice, garnished with sesame seeds and green scallions. The rice is fluffy and individual grains are visible.
scenes.voice_over: Craving takeout? Learn how to make restaurant-quality egg fried rice in minutes with just a few simple ingredients.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients laid out on a table: 3 cups of cooked rice, 3 eggs in a bowl, and a bunch of scallions.
scenes.voice_over: For this recipe you'll need 3 cups of cooked rice, preferably day-old.  You'll also need 3 large eggs, and 3 to 4 scallions.

scenes.image_prompt: Chopped scallions separated into white and green parts on a cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: First, finely chop the scallions, separating the white and green parts.  Whisk the eggs together in a bowl until light and frothy.

scenes.image_prompt: A wok or large skillet on a stovetop. White parts of scallions are being sauteed in oil, releasing a fragrant aroma.
scenes.voice_over: Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of oil and sauté the white parts of the scallions until softened, about 30 seconds.

scenes.image_prompt: Scrambled eggs cooking in the wok, still slightly moist and soft.
scenes.voice_over: Reduce heat to medium-low. Add the whisked eggs and gently scramble until they are just set but still slightly moist.  Remove the eggs and set them aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Green parts of the scallions stir-frying in the wok, followed by the addition of soy sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Increase the heat back to medium-high. Add the remaining oil to the skillet and stir-fry the green parts of the scallions for about 30 seconds.  Add soy sauce and stir.

scenes.image_prompt: Cooked rice being added to the wok and stir-fried with the scallions and soy sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Add the cooked rice to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, breaking up any clumps, until heated through.

scenes.image_prompt: Scrambled eggs being returned to the wok and gently mixed with the rice.
scenes.voice_over: Return the scrambled eggs to the wok. Gently mix with the rice, breaking the eggs into smaller pieces.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished egg fried rice being seasoned with sesame oil and sesame seeds.
scenes.voice_over: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle with sesame oil and sprinkle with sesame seeds for extra flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: A plate of finished egg fried rice, garnished with sesame seeds and scallions. Chopsticks are placed alongside the plate. A small bowl of sriracha sauce is in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Serve immediately. Egg fried rice is delicious on its own or as a side dish.  Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For best results, use day-old rice. Freshly cooked rice can be too moist and result in a sticky fried rice.
If using fresh rice, spread it out on a baking sheet to dry it out before frying.
Don't overcook the eggs. They should be soft and slightly runny, as they will continue to cook in the rice.
Adjust the amount of soy sauce to your preference.
